page.title: 18THE MEASURED MILE.
page.content: Boat Builders need to know a boats {R.P.M.}They check this by using the measured mile.They have to line up two posts ,the higher one by Privett Road,the shorter one on Browndown,a third is located at Gilkicker.They must make at least four to six runs in both directions to allow for the wind and tide. The boats must keep a{steady course and check the{distance}from a chart as these measured miles are not always a sea mile.The lenth of the one in our area is{7997 feet}long. There are 14 similar measured miles in the British Isles mostly used by shallow water vessels because larger and faster vessels cause too much wash.They test the boats 1/2 a mile off shore, where it is 9 fathoms deep.
